Steps to Set Up Localization

Architecture Notes

  • Crafter has no native concept of translation
    • That doesn't mean that it cannot be built employed using standard design patterns
  • What does translation support mean?
    • Content must know its language
    • Content must be able to identify its translations
  • This is ultimately done by linking the translations to the source
    • sometimes this is done by designating a particular language as the "source" and translations contain a reference to the source
    • sometimes this is done by introducing a whole new identifier that is common to both the source and the translation(s)
  • Crafter's approach:
    • Place content in a folder corresponding to its locale
    • Linkage between translations is defined by the path - two files in the same location but with different language folders are defined as translations of one another(oratleast,dynamiclocalizationsofoneanother)
      • e.g.
        • These two are translations: 
          • /site/website/en/home/index.xml
          • /site/website/en/home/index.xml
        • So are these:
          • /site/website/en/style/hats/index.xml
          • /site/website/es/style/hats/index.xml
        • But these are not:
          • /site/website/en/style/hats/index.xml
          • /site/website/es/style/argentinian-hats/index.xml
  • How can this be used?
    • Two primary use cases
      • Content creation
      • Content lookup
  • Notes about the current implementation:
    • Only using a 2-letter locale code. We could have used the whole locale code instead.

Content Creation

  • As of now, no built-in tools to right-click and choose "translate this", so instead you have to manually create the translation by clicking "copy" on the source item, and then clicking "paste" where you would like the translation created (this is not bad)
  • You have to then manually re-wire relationships in the copied content
    • e.g. if an article points to a related item, the related item will keep pointing to the related item in the source language until you create the translation of it and then manually re-link it.

Content Lookup

  • Site Item Service has been taught how to fall back to a default language
